thread.title: Indian Railways to run special train to facilitate pilgrims
thread.title_full: Indian Railways to run special train to facilitate pilgrims | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Indian Railways to run special train to facilitate pilgrims
text:
Other Articles DBS sees FY16 GDP growth at 7.4% with downside risks Niti Aayog may discuss issues facing electronics sector on Monday Realty destination: With $2 bn investments in H1 2015, Dubai a new favourite for Indians For the convenience of pilgrims planning to visit Salasar Dham in Rajasthan, North-Western Railway will be running a special train between Hisar and Sujangarh (Rajasthan) daily for four days from October 25 to October 28.
The special train will depart from Hisar on October 25 at 6.35 in the morning to reach Sujangarh at 10.50 AM.
Similarly, the same train will depart from Sujangarh at 4.40 in the evening on the same day to reach Hisar at 9.10 PM, a spokesman of the Railways said today.
He said the train will have stoppages at Siwani, Sadalpur, Churu and Rattangarh. This special train will have 12 bogies.
Notably, during present days, over one thousand passengers were travelling from Hisar to Salasar Dham daily.
 24, 2015 1:11 pm
